string.text: 진남군은 염나라 남동쪽, 진령산맥 남쪽 기슭에 위치한 연나라 남부 최대의 도시이다. 지형은 북서쪽이 높고 평평하며 경작지가 많고 남동쪽이 낮고 저지대 지형과 삼림이 많다. 진령산맥을 따라 남쪽으로 여행한 염나라의 상인들은 종종 이곳에 머물렀고 동시에 지역 번영을 촉진했다. 검은 파도가 공격했을 때, 가장 먼저 영향을 받은 도시였다. 이후, 검은 파도에 저항한 것을 기념하기 위해 '진남'이라 이름했다. 연방은 염나라의 남부를 공격하려는 시도를 포기해야 했다.

낙안성은 천용성 북쪽에 있으며, 천용성과 반향한다. 낙안시는 북쪽으로 낙수강, 동쪽으로 외연산을 접하고 있다, 제국 북쪽의 곡물통로를 지키고 있으며, 천용성 북쪽의 마지막 방어선이기도 하다. 연나라 황제는 낙수를 넘어 침략한 5개국 연합군을 물리쳤다. 전설에 따르면, 낙수의 신이 연나라 사람들의 선조들에게 와서 고기잡이, 가축 기르기, 화전 재배, 뽕나무 재배, 직조, 생산 및 생활을 가르치고, 첫번째 도시인 낙성을 세웠다고 한다. 낙수가 여러 차례 범람하자 염나라의 선조들은 남쪽으로 이동하여 대부분의 사람들이 천용성으로 이주하였다. 검은 파도의 공격 이후 제국 북부의 도시를 재건했고 '낙수가 안전하면 세상이 안전하다'는 뜻에서 '낙안'이라 이름하였다.
낚시와 사냥의 장소라는 뜻의 아르흐덴 시는 나칸 반도 남부의 산중 해안가에 위치하고 있다. 북부 국가는 혹독한 추운 기후와 극도로 낮은 작물 수확량을 가지고 있습니다. 해적업이 시작되기 전 북방 민족은 주로 고기잡이와 사냥을 하며 살았다. 뛰어난 지리적 위치로 인해 세프라그는 원래 어촌에서 중요한 모피 및 목재 무역 센터로 발전했습니다.

한때 전설적인 해적 라그나르와 실드메이든 라가타의 도시였던 헬린저는 동결 기간이 매우 짧은 노스랜드의 천연 항구인 나칸 반도의 남서쪽 경계 절벽 계곡에 위치하고 있다. 라그나르는 자신이 약탈한 막대한 부를 통해 요새화된 해적 요새를 건설했다. 그곳에는 피에 굶주린 북부 전사들이 모여 배를 타고 알려진 세계의 모든 것을 약탈했습니다. 그러나 라그나르는 해적 경력의 전성기에 용의 제국 염나라에 패했고, 그의 유해는 결국 그곳에 묻혔다.
사막의 연꽃, 마라한 시는 건조한 기후의 사막 오아시스 도시다. 이 도시는 마르보해 남안 깊숙한 곳에 위치한 해상과 육로 무역의 도시로, 대추야자나무와 야자수, 올리브 나무 그늘에 하얀 건물이 마치 하얀 연꽃이 떠 있는 것처럼 숨겨져 있다.

하얀 도시 키로하. 마르보해 남안과 가까우며 서해의 난류의 영향을 받습니다. 기후는 온화하고 나무는 상록수입니다. 본토 남부의 광활한 사막에 있는 진주입니다. 라블람 사람들을 향한 알라의 은총으로, 라블람 사람들은 영리한 사업가입니다. 북해안의 염나라와의 좋은 관계와 우수한 지리적 위치로 인해 시아스시는 해상 무역과 어업의 발전이 많이 축적되었다. 부를 축적하고 뛰어난 예술적, 문화적 업적을 남겼다.
나비아는 대륙 중부 구릉지대의 밀밭에 위치한다. 프로옌의 중심 무역 도시로, 현재 프로옌 왕의 고향이기도 하다. 염나라와의 전쟁 가운데 내륙 도시들이 오랫 동안 최전선에 있거나 공성을 당하는 사이, 나비아의 무력이 강화되어 프로옌 연방 전체를 장악하게 되었다.

거룩한 빛의 도시 스윈풀은 프로옌 서부의 광활한 평원에 위치한다. 늘 푸른 계절과 쾌적한 기온, 고도로 발달된 농업으로 본토 서부 제일의 곡창지대가 되었다. 프로옌 사람들은 이곳을 신이 주신 곳, 빛이 마지막까지 비추는 곳이라고 믿는다. 도시 중앙에 서 있는 고딕 성당은 프로옌 사람들의 굳건한 신앙을 대표한다. 염나라와 프로옌 사이의 긴 전쟁 속에서도 용황은 프로옌 사람들의 힘과 용기를 대표하는 이 도시를 점령하지 못했다.

월러스 군단의 군사 요새인 메르켈 시는 삼림 늪 지대에 위치한다. 월러스 사람들은 항상 끊임없이 이동하기에, 약자는 제거되고, 강한 전사들과 그들을 따랐던 용감한 여성들만이 살아남았다. 이로써 그들은 강인하고 끈질긴 종족으로 발전하여 전 국민이 군인인 군단 체제를 형성하였다. 그들은 인생에서 아름답고 섬세한 것들에 대해 별로 신경 쓰지 않으며, 학습에서 여성적이라고 생각하는 것에는 별로 관심이 없다. 그래서 당신이 시우무 시에서 보는 것은 군단의 압제적인 군사력을 상징하는 아름다운 돌과 나무 장벽이다.

루나 호수변에 위치한 월러스의 성지, 리스크모스. 월러스 사람들은 대륙 북서부의 깊은 숲, 산, 늪 및 기타 야생 지역에 살았다. 그들은 야만적이지만 강인했다. 그들은 자연에 파묻혀 있기 싫어했고, 개척을 원했다. 그들은 루나 호수변에 도착할 때까지 계속 움직였다. 전설에 따르면, 달의 신이 세상에 와서 깊고 고요한 호수 물로 월러스 사람들의 광적인 마음을 씻어주었다고 한다. 그들은 호수 옆에 살면서 월러스 최초의 도시, 거룩한 땅 리스크모스를 만들었다.

바얀쿨룬은 초원의 강이 흐르는 계곡, 풍부한 물과 풀, 곧 유목민의 천국을 의미한다. 원래는 코사크족이 염나라와 교역하기 위해 건설한 토성이었다. 그러나 지금은 모그리안 칸의 하얀 깃발이 나부끼고 있다. 모그리안 사람들은 무자비하고 강력한 정복자들이다. 그들은 언젠가 그들의 신 퉁게리가 세상의 모든 재물을 가장 용감한 전사들에게 줄 것이라 믿는다. 칸의 철기병은 초원을 정복했고, 코사크족은 목장의 노예로 만들었다.

케시키린은 모그리안 말로 '행복과 신성함의 고원'을 의미한다. 모그리안의 선조들은 고원의 물과 풀밭에 살았다. 그때, 수도는 유동적이었고 고정되지 않았으며, 초원의 유목민일 뿐이었다. 후에, 염나라의 상인들이 무역로를 열기 위해 서쪽으로 오는 길에 종종 여기서 쉬었고, 방어와 보급을 위해 도시를 건설했다. 그 후로, 초원의 중북부에 있는 초원의 고지대는 모비 고원의 상업과 종교의 중심인 큰 도시가 되었다. 초원왕이 초원의 모든 세력을 통합한 이후, 그는 염나라의 수비대를 물리치고 이곳에 수도를 세웠다.

울란바리는 사이지아 호수 서안에 위치한 모그리아에서 가장 비옥한 땅이자 최대 방목지이다. 월러스 군단은 이곳을 오랫동안 탐냈고, 이 초원을 차지하기 위해 군단을 파견했다. 월러스 군단을 몰아내기 위해 초원왕은 이곳에서 치열한 전투를 벌여 초원과 성벽을 붉게 물들여 '붉다'는 뜻의 이름으로 불렀다. 그 이후로 모그리안 사람들은 이렇게 말한다. '초원왕이 채찍을 휘두르는 곳은 모두 모그리안 사람이 유목하는 곳이다.''
바텔 하다는 초원의 가장 오래된 도시로, 사이지아 호수 우안의 고지대에 위치한다. 3개의 무역로가 교차하는 지점에 있으며, 호수 건너로 염나라와 마주하고 있다. 뭉고 칸의 소유로, 그는 그곳의 궁전에서 모든 것을 바라보고 있다. 멀리 산맥 뒤에는 염나라의 풍요로운 땅이 있는데, 그는 언젠가 저 땅에서 풀을 먹이려 한다.
Tubiris is located in Sharas Bay, also known as Shariz by the Aserai. Villagers sail to the shoals between the islands to find and Fish for tuna, sardines and sharks.

The Sahel is on the edge of the Aserai territory, on the low Assab Mountains. The mountains hold rain clouds from the Yeshm Sea, And the monsoons blowing from the southeast have enabled the local water storage farms to grow chestnuts and wheat.

Asmet is located at the corner of the Assab Mountains and borders the desert depths to the south. Villagers use the water to intercept the mountain's torrents during rare rainstorms. Plant date palms and other crops.

The villagers of Ain Barik thrive around a well in an open valley that cuts the cliffs of Jaljara from the west of Mount Tamar. It is divided. The surrounding land, although dry, still produces enough pasture to breed horses in spring.
Deir Hawa is located on the south bank of the windy sea of ​​Yeshm, as the Aserai call it. Villagers obtain water from surface runoff from the mountains and Flax is grown in the lowlands.
Medeni is located in the lowland between the Yeshm Sea and the Djerjarai cliffs. In the rainy season, the surface water from the cliffs is used to irrigate the date palm gardens on the shore.

Jidnar is located on the floodplain of the Damar River, which crosses the Jerrjarai cliffs and is the most densely populated place in Aserai. Local Farmers rely on the silt from the annual periodic flooding of the river to grow grains.
Jamayeh is located on the southern shore of what the Aserai call 'Bahir Yeshm', the 'Emerald Sea'. Although the rainy season is short in the area , but the climate is very suitable for olive trees.

Hibal Zumr is located on the banks of the 'Nehr Kellers', which is the Lime River. The water is fertile and the soil can be grown. . But not far to the south, is the barren saline-alkali land, and can only grow some particularly well-supported crops.
Ugba is located on the seaside of Polas. The villagers obtain rainwater and surface water from the mountains to irrigate their fields and date palms.
Ben Ghez is located at the entrance of the Great Wadi that separates the Jaljaray Cliffs from Mount Tamar. Villagers dig wells to obtain the wadi's Groundwater, used to irrigate olive groves.
Tamnu sits on the edge of a large lagoon divided by a spit in the Pallas Sea. Villagers scrape clay from the shallows and sell it to local potters.
The Oasis Village of Barihala is located on the edge of a wadi in the Djaljarai Cliff Mesa. The area is best known for its horses raised on short-lived, fat spring grass.

Abu Kommel is located on the steep upper reaches of the Trang River that crosses the Ukalion Plateau. Local tribes grow grapes on the hillside, using To make a white wine popular with the Empire and Valandian nobility.

Lanoke Heng is located on a high mountain ridge in the Ukalion Massif. The villagers are skilled pig farmers and there are two paths after they descend the mountain. , one to the west to Vallandia, the other to the Empire to the east.
The Cantrek is located in the rocky Barasog Gorge that leads from the Empire's territory to the Ucalion Plateau. The soil is not very fertile, But the high bushland is good for raising pigs.
Druidmore is located in Morcon, a rift valley that divides the Ukalion Plateau from the Ebo Peninsula. Miners are on the side of a local mountain. Silver ore was found in the crack.

Pendrak is located on a steep slope in the north of Ukalion, facing Valcheg Bay. There were occasional skirmishes from the raiding teams of Dania and Sturgia. As soon as the villagers who were raising pigs heard the warning horns, they drove the herds into their hideouts in the mountains.

Remtoir is located under a fissure in the eastern cliffs of the Ukalion Plateau, near the source of the Miron River, which the Battanians call 'Mir'. This is the most fertile place in Albatania, and the wheat harvest is good.
Clegg Baan sits under a cliff in the Ukalion Massif. Villagers collect clay from the nearby Mill River and sell it to Batani Potters in the towns of Asia.
Flintog is located on the top of a mountain in the eastern part of the Ukalion Massif. The soil is poor, but the trees grow thick, making it a Battanian The main source of wood.
Glyntoll overlooks the fast-flowing Fair River, where the water from Lake Taiwal flows into Valcheg Bay. Horses raised in local meadows are prepared Favored by North Sturgian bandits and traders.

Aster sits in a shallow valley between the hills and Granis in northeastern Ukalion. The locals are more concerned with trade than war, and the tribal elders They encourage the planting of mulberry trees to maintain a small-scale silk weaving industry.

Uselem is located on a ridge on the eastern border of Albatania, overlooking a tributary of the Mill River. The locals are forest farmers who harvest oak, Yew and pine, and sell lumber to builders and boat builders.
Varagos sits on the banks of the Arris River, where small rivers from the highlands flow into the deep Lake Ophrtis. The soil is not very fertile, But enough to feed sheep.
Rocana is located on the eastern shore of Lake Laconis. This muddy, low-lying land is ideal for growing flax.
Lessos is located on a high plateau in the Delua Mountains. Highland cattle thrive on the highland pastures here.
Gaos is located in the hills east of the empire, in the broad valley of Mizeyard. Nomads once occupied this place, and the village takes its name from their language The name for 'cow'.
Atelion is located in the valley of Nevis, where a slow, icy current flows into Lake Laconis. This flat, moist land is suitable for growing flax.
Ataconia sits on a plateau in front of the Delua Mountains. Locals are good at spotting silver deposits exposed by runoff from the mountains.

Ebinosa is located in the extreme north of the Empire, just on the southern bank of the Glacier Lake on the Iltam transport line, Lake Laconis and Lake Tanasis There is a steady stream of boats in between. The area is relatively sparsely populated, but there are large herds of cattle grazing in the lush meadows.
Syratos sits on a cliff on the north shore of Lake Thanasis. Cold winters can shatter rock, allowing iron buried deep within The veins were exposed, and the villagers were mining on the mountain.

Mekarovia overlooks the Galkas Falls, a series of fast currents that eventually join the Miron River Lake Laconis. The village sits on a cliff to protect this frontier from bandits and gangs. The cascading waterfall slaps the cliff and exposes a lot of ore, and the villagers make their living from it.

Oderusa is located on the far eastern frontier of the Empire, across the Tiagus River is the territory of what is now the Khuset Khanate. Despite the arid climate, the Trees such as oaks still grow in the corners of the Tiagos Gorge and other valleys, providing raw materials for the small-scale timber industry.

Correnia is one of the most remote villages in the Empire, where people still speak Karadish. It is located on the plains southeast of Lake Tanasis Up, near the Akkan hills. After that mountain, only Darcy and the languages ​​of the steppe peoples are spoken. The local villagers grow grain and are always on the lookout for raiders.

Mutakia is located on the borderland of the southern shore of Lake Tanasis across the Tiagus River. This imperial colony was built in peacetime and is a silk-woven The mulberry planting center needed by the industry.

Melion is in Mizeyard, a narrow valley near the center of the rugged plateau in the eastern part of the Empire. Local villagers grow mulberry trees and harvest the leaves to feed silkworms. , the resulting silk thread is cherished by both the elegant imperial nobles in court clothes and the savage herders and frontiers, who wear silk clothing under their armor as an extra layer of protection against arrows.

Sagorina sits at the bottom of a narrow valley in Mizeyard, a rugged plateau east of Calradia. Silver mining in the nearby mountains explains the Empire Why has this place been conquered and defended for centuries.

Ravenia is a fishing village on the northeast coast of the Sea of ​​Perth. A nearby castle guards the gateway to Aserai's territory, which is connected by lakes The transportation network with the lagoon is called Calesa.

Ethemisa is located on the banks of the River of Bitterness, known by the Aserai as Nehel Kellers, and the inhabitants of the Empire call it Castle Lessa. The river here has just flowed from the seaside hills and has not yet reached the saline plains in the southeast. The wheat harvest in the nearby land is good.
Morenia overlooks the Settles River and is located at the low entrance to the Lycaria Valley. Villagers gather clay by the river to supply the Empire Kilns in the South.

Settlements is located on the west side of Oni Rock, a huge rock outcropping in the middle of the Lycaria Valley. Some say the rock got its name from it From the vultures who gathered here to feast on corpses, while those who died were still working in the local silver mines.

Yoglius is located on the flat west shore of Lake Tanasis. The land was originally inhabited by nomadic tribes until recently cultivated. Imperial settlers paid Great efforts have been made to grow mulberry and sericulture here, and obtain high-profit products.
Canopsis is built around the headwaters of the Setis River on the Mizeyard Plateau. Wheat grows beautifully on this sunny plain.

The cape between the Gulf of Salas and the Inland Sea of ​​Plas is named Garonto. Coastal meadows are lush, these higher grasses are salty to the sea It is well tolerated and can be used for good horses.

Torios is located in the valley of the Arris River in the hinterland of Calradia. River irrigation and a relatively warm inland climate ensure that the area is The productive wheat fields of Bergon fed many people in the middle of the empire.

Bergon is located in the valley of the Arris River in the hinterland of Calradia. The irrigation of the river and the relatively warm inland climate ensure that the area shares The high yielding wheat fields of Rios fed many people in the middle of the empire.
Onika sits on the northern shore of the Sea of ​​Pallas. The hills here are home to the famous terraced olive groves in the south of the Empire, producing a light and aromatic olive oil.

Three Keto is located by a small bay that joins the Gulf of Salas. It is blown by the hot south wind and moistened by mountain springs. It is used by the landowners of the empire. for experimental planting of date palms.

Viron is located in the hills of the Ukalion Massif, near the headwaters of the Galius River. The hills beside the village are full of shepherds' fire on summer nights. Their animals are taken to highland pastures to graze.
Gorelin is situated on the warm and oaked hills of Epir, near the border of Vallandia and Batania. Sheep are raised in The area is a livelihood, as is sheep stealing.
Hetogaia is located near Mount Eritreus, a giant basalt mountain that rises from the ground. Villagers grow olives on the slopes.

Elvania is located by the Gulf of Ortesia, where the shipping route between the Western Ocean and the Sea of ​​Peras passes through. The olive trees growing on the nearby hillsides enjoy the The warm sun in the south.

Gercegos is located in the valley of the Miron River that separates the Crags of Curción and the Deruia Mountains. The villagers open up a mountain mouth overlooking the village. ore, which produces silver and other precious metals.

Usaik Village is located under the Akkan hills on the east bank of Lake Tanasis, called the Danaz Sea by the Qusetts. The villagers lived a nomadic life not long ago, and the wool on their sheep is long and good.
The village of Esme and its surrounding villages are located on the Devsag Plateau on the landward side of the Akkan Hills. This is the main grazing area for the Kuset and his allies ground.
Archesel is located at the southern end of the Akkan Hills. The soil is so fractured and weathered that iron ore layers are exposed in the ravines.
Hakun village is located on the cliffs of Akkan hills. People here have long mined silver in the mountains. Happy to support the industry.

The village of Tepes overlooks a tributary of the Karakazi River, which flows from the north into Danaz, known to the Empire as Tanasis The sea. The area is rich in wood, and people go down the river and sell it to the towns by the lake.

Himli is located in a basin on the Devsag Plateau. Although the land is almost year-round dry, it still has winter snows and a muddy spring. High-quality clay is collected from puddles left by snow and rain.

Dinar is located in the far north of the Khuset Tribal Alliance, along the Karakazi River. Although the area is snowed almost all year round, the spring grass A considerable number of sheep are still supported, and the thick wool they produce helps protect the people from the harsh local winds.

Kalahari is located in the far north of the Qusset Tribal Alliance, not far from the icy Biarri Sea. Although the area is snowed almost all year round, the spring grass A considerable number of sheep are still supported, and the thick wool they produce helps protect against the biting wind from the sea.
Simila is located on the east side of the Devsag Plateau, from which it enters the Great Grass Sea. Cow.
Ezenur is located on the banks of the Tiagus River in the local dialect of Tejas. Villagers mine iron ore on outcrops along the The water flow is reddish due to the iron in the soil.

Kesar is located in the northeastern part of Kuset territory, in the valley of the Karakazi River. The area is covered with snow almost all year round, but the villagers still raise animals Cattle with the cold wind blowing downstream from the north.

Payamu is located in the cold north of the Kuset territory, along the Karakazi River. Although the area is covered with snow almost all year round, the villagers live in the land Wheat and barley were sown just after thawing, so the autumn harvest was not bad.

Ustok is located on the windy Kachar Peninsula between Valcheg Bay and the Biari Sea. The hardy northern cattle raised by the locals will Find grass to eat between the cracks, and add some seaweed in difficult times.
Mazardan is near the headwaters of the Galkas River, due west of Lake Laconis. Villagers of this dank land will be in muddy valleys Plant flax.

Nevyansk is located on a flat hill overlooking Valcheg Bay. The climate is cold, but the surface waters that flow down the hills bring fertile Soil, villagers will grow hardy crops such as rye and barley.
De Ning is located on a grassy meadow overlooking the narrow part of Valcheg Bay. Horses graze on the highlands, occasionally glancing at the longboats and small fishing boats passing below.
Kranirog is located in an open forest valley overlooking the Garza River. The villagers here are good hunters, hunting mink, fox and rabbit skins to supply the southern High demand.

Ismircog is situated on the grassy lowlands between the Garza and Vastra rivers, two small tributaries of the Miron River. Local Most of the people both raised and stole cattle, and long plundered the imperial frontier villages to the east and the Battanians to the west.
Auf is a newer Sturgian colony in the Ikara Wastes - a forest northwest of Lake Laconis. The villagers brave the cold and Wolves, fur-seeking, moody forest dwellers, and bounty hunters of the North.

Fihe is located in the Ikara Wastes - the northern edge of the forest northwest of Lake Laconis. It is a stronghold for traders who venture into the depths of the forest, those who need Confront the cold and the wolves, the fur-seeking, moody forest dwellers, and the bounty hunters of the North.

Takor is a cattle village located in what the Altanians call Minard River, or 'Mountain of War'. At the mountain pass. Their empire and Sturgia neighbors called it 'Minadore'. This was one of the main passages between the desolate north and the relatively stable empire of the empire, both for commerce and for plunder.

Ulyx Kara is located on the Iletan transport line, a network of glacial lakes, Laconis and Tanasis Long boats can be towed and sailed between them. Villagers catch spiny bass and crayfish in the shallows, dry them and sell them to travelers.
Vlakiv is located in the cold and dark forest valley at the foot of Mount Illetan. Hardy cattle in this area will dig through the thick snow to find grass in winter. , this will last until spring.
Yusank sits on a small cove that joins Salas Bay. This warm southern land is perfect for olive trees.
Ungar sits in warm woodland near the meandering Trang River. This wheat-rich land was once the heart of the empire, but now Varandi The center of the kingdom of Asia.
Fitton is on a corner of the meandering Trang River, not far from the pass that leads to the Biscayne Hills. Villagers in the warm, dry Olives are grown on a hillside.
Derabon is located on the tip of Cape Farr, just south of the mouth of the Trang River. Villagers venture far and wide to find cod fish engulfed by the cold north.

Oman Fade is located on the edge of a small rushing river that runs down from the Leonor Mountains and joins Lake Oaks. The mountains have plenty of rain, wheat and The barley is growing satisfactorily.
Tierby is located by the cold, foggy waters off the Ebo Peninsula. The low-lying areas north of Ebo are suitable for flax cultivation.

Silandak sits at the foot of the mountains of the Ebo Peninsula, slightly blocking the biting wind from the northwest. Immigrants from all over Vallandia come Go here to find the silver mine by the stream.
Kalius is located on the foggy coastal plain south of Valcheg Bay. And the language of ingredients in Albatania, they grow flax in the lowlands.
Driat is located between Valcheg Bay and the ridge of the Ebo Peninsula. Local villagers hunt beavers and minks in the mountains and sometimes in the waters of the bay. Seals.
Tallyville is located in the middle of the Trang Valley in the heart of Calradia. Local villagers grow olives on the hillsides.
Vereksan is located by the waters of Lake Oaks, a small, deep inland lake. Local villagers grow wheat on the flat grasslands around the lake.
Tasheba is located on the west coast of the Yeshm Sea. Fishermen enter protected waters that are calm most of the year for tuna and sardines.
Bag is located slightly inland from the Yeshm Sea, at the foot of a huge granite outcrop, Mount Tamar. The sea breeze brings the highlands here. Just enough rain to plant some olive trees.
Farnab sits on a low promontory between the Gulf called Sharez by the Aserai and the Inner Sea of ​​Yeshm. The sea breeze brings Just enough rain to plant some olive trees.
Hiblet sits at the foot of a huge granite outcrop called Mount Tamar. Rainwater stored in crevices is diverted to the village's date palm garden .
La Mesa is located on the open plain on the east coast of the Yeshm Sea, with sparse acacia forests nearby. Some of the best horses in Aserai are in Graze in the area.
Abu Shi is located on the banks of the Keles River that flows to the South Barren Lands. The land around here was once an ancient river bed, now barren and alkaline, but Date palms still grow here.

Huja is located in the far east of Aserai, on the banks of the Tiagus River. This land is basically a desert steppe and is barren for most of the year. There are only some bushes, but in the spring there will be flowers and grasses suitable for horses.

Abuba is located on the edge of the deep desert, at the foot of the landward side of the Jaljaray cliffs. Runoff from the mountains accumulates underground, forming a The springs that maintain the oasis, the wheat thrives in the fields and fields.
Hunab is located in a dry valley below the weathered platform of the Jaljaray cliffs. Local villagers use the short but lush grass that covers the hillside in spring to raise their horses .
Bill Saif sits between the large and small wells and lakes in the Jaljarai cliffs. Villagers dug into the shallow groundwater area to collect clay and sell it To the potters in the Nahasa Desert.
Gabrab sits on the edge of an open bay on the southern coast of the Sea of ​​Perth. The low-lying coastline is ideal for salt pans.

Musum near the eastern shore of the Yeshm Sea, where the deserts of Aserai are replaced by desert steppes scattered with acacia trees and bushes The local villagers dug wells to fetch water to irrigate the date palm trees.

Kuga sits at the foot of a small hill to the east of the Yeshm Sea, where the Aserai desert gives way to a desert with acacia trees and bushes Grassland. Local villagers dig wells to water the date palm trees.

Dorja is a fishing village on the coast of Yeshm. Villagers go out to sea in barques to catch perch, which sometimes grows longer than a man. People Also keep an eye out for saltwater crocodiles in local bays and swamps, which compete with villagers for prey.

Mahloul is located in the desert steppe on the south side of the Yeshm Sea, in an open canyon between the Jaljarai cliffs and Mount Assab. The groundwater is just enough It is used to grow subsistence crops, and the villagers also graze the rich grasslands on Mount Ashabi after the spring rainy season and earn some money by raising horses.
Livas is located in a wide valley on the south side of the Yeshm Sea. There is limited farmland, and it is best known for its horses fed on the short-lived, plump spring grass of the desert. .
Valletas is near Bahr Yeshm, which means 'Emerald Sea'. The lowlands here are ideal for flax cultivation.

Damar River meanders all the way to the Yeshm Sea, and Mijait is located at the mouth of the river. The silt carried by the river is deposited here, making the It became one of the most fertile areas of the Aserai land.

Hamshawar is located at the mouth of the lower Damal River, which eventually flows into the Yeshm Sea. The silt carried by the river is deposited here, This makes it one of the most fertile areas of the Aserai land.
Jhassim is located on the southern shore of the Inland Sea known to the Aserai as 'Bahel Yeshm'. The warm waters of the area are rich in tuna, bonito Fish, sardines, etc.

Nahran is located on the alluvial plain formed by the Djaljarai cliffs and divided by the Damar River. The local soil is destroyed each year by silt brought by torrents. Fertility is restored, so wheat yields are high.

Vadal is located in the dry valley of the rocky rocky side of the Djerjarai cliffs, not far from barren gravel plains and dunes. Spring and winter At that time, clouds from the Yeshm Sea will drop the last of the water here, nourishing just enough grass for the local horse industry.

Beit Khatif is located on an alluvial plain formed by the Djaljarai cliffs and divided by the Damal River. The rocky soils of the area limit the effectiveness of irrigation. , but the spring grass on the mountain allows the horses to thrive.
Mabwaz overlooks the Damal River that winds its way through the Djerjarai cliff mesa. Villagers grow wheat and other crops on the silt of the floodplain. .

Zalem is located at the Scorched Gate, where the Damar River originates from the Nahasa Desert and passes through the Jaljarai cliffs. The river carries the The silt makes for a good local wheat harvest.

Azbet Nahul is located in a town overlooking a town called Bahir Yeshm, or the 'Emerald Sea' as it's known by the Aserai. It is located on the corner of a rocky mountain. The groundwater accumulated between the rock crevices can be obtained from a well and used to irrigate the wheat fields in the village.
Abgan is located on the edge of a small lagoon on the southern shore of Bahir Yeshm, the 'Emerald Sea'. Local villagers fish for tuna, sardines, Bonito and Shark.
Dalmengues is located on the banks of Lake Tevar, a dark lake in the middle of the Ukalion massif. The land here is flat, fertile and rich in rain. Suitable for growing wheat and barley.
Eberes sits on a saddle ridge with Lake Tevar on one side and a pass to the Kaval Valley on the other. Local villagers plant grapes to make sweet white wines from the Albatania region.

Berglomeai is located in a corner of the cliffs on the southern side of the Ucalion massif. Except for the deposits on the mountain and the bog iron ore in the swamp, here There's nothing more attractive.
Ath Karvar is near Karvar Valley - the beginning of a steep valley leading to Imperial territory. High quality of clay.

Diantogmel is located on the banks of Lin Taiwal, or the 'Dark Lake'. There are more than a dozen local legends explaining the origin of the place's name - Meaning 'Battle of the Stoats' - but no two versions match the details. The local villagers grow grapes to make wine.

Glenlisrigg - a slippery valley - is located on the highlands north of Ukalion. The local villagers are mainly forest farmers, serving The nearby fortified towns of Dungranis and Ka Banthes provide lumber.
Morichig is located in a basin in the middle of the Ukalion Massif. This area is known for its wheat and barley production.
Imlage is located on the rolling hills in the middle of the Ukalion massif. This village specializes in the white grapes used to make the sweet wines of Albatania.
Lin Doon is located on the green hills northwest of the Lin Taiwar - the dark lake. The surrounding farmland is grown with wheat and barley.
Borg Bess is located in a low forest valley east of the Ukalion Massif. Villagers trap beavers in the dark swampy woodlands , foxes and other fur animals.

Gnart Gnar is a village near the legendary duel site in Batania, where Gnar is said to have left his head. Known for their excellent ranger skills, the local villagers helped the fortress of Ka Banthes on the nearby cliffs to defend the heart of Batania from the Sturgians and other marauders.

To Leard, Full Moon Hill, is located under a small wooded hill in northern Albatania. Local villagers cut down oak, yew and beech forests. For hundreds of years, the Altanians have taken care of these trees, ensuring that there is always enough wood to be harvested and sold.
Tor Melina is located in a swampy basin in the dark wooded hills northwest of the Ucalion Massif. Villagers extract clay from damp soil , sold to potters in nearby towns.
Bryn Glass sits on a cliff to the east of the Ukalion Massif. Villagers mine iron ore from the mountains and sell it to the great blacksmith in Shaunong.
Anduin is located on a chasm in the mountain overlooking Lin Taiwal, the dark lake. Villagers in the area plant trees, harvest beech, oak and Yew, and then sold to towns.
Mag Alba sits on a meadow overlooking Lin Taiwal, the dark lake. The villagers grow flax in the muddy valley.
Swingling overlooks the rocky waterfall that blocks the dark waters of Lake Tevar to form the lake in the middle of Ukalion. Horses ride on rapids and waterfalls Forage on the grass above.

Shordas is situated in the lowlands on the eastern border of Battania, at the foot of the cliffs of Ukalion. The nearby Fortress of Uselem protects the exposing the farm to protect it from raiders from the Sturgians to the east.

Doune is located below the upper gorge of the Trang River. When the water is flat, villagers scrape silt from the river's pools and mud pools and follow the winding The path carried the silt to Pen Cannock on the cliffs above them.
The Gaineses are located on the eastern boundary of the Ukalion Massif, in a dark forested valley below the Leonor Hills. Local villagers gather dirt in the wetlands, Sold to Pen Cannock's potter.

Vernon Étille is located on an outcrop overlooking the headwaters of the Étille, a tributary of the Trang River. Local villagers grow grapes and make a preparation A highly numbered wine from Albatania, respected by the Imperials and Valandians.

Inves is located at the point where the Trang and Etil rivers tumble from the Ucalion massif and join the two rivers into central Vallandia The plains. The surrounding hills are suitable for growing wheat.

Maratea sits on a narrow stretch of land between the Miron River and the highest peak of the Delua Mountains, Mount Arakatos. The local villagers are skilled miners. , mines iron ore from nearby cliffsides.

Statymos is located in a narrow valley below the towering ridges of the Dria Mountains. Highland streams irrigate the fertile soil on the slopes, making the area an One of the granaries of the north of the empire.
Located far west of Lake Laconis, Jumose is a secluded fishing village by the side of Diatema Bay. Local villagers will spend time in the deep waters of the bay. Fishing for pike.
Diopalis is located in a valley in the Delua Mountains. Despite the cold winters, the fertile soil of the area makes it an important location for the Northern Empire Granary.
Arothea is far west of Lake Laconis, near the entrance to Diatama Bay. Locals rely on the lake for barracuda and sturgeon. Fish live very prosperously.
Yelakos is located in the meadows of the northern foothills of the Delua Mountains. Breezy winds from the lake keep the climate mild and good for breeding horses.
Masangara sits on the banks of the Nevis River, an icy river that flows slowly into Lake Laconis. Once a swamp forest, people now Drain the water and turn it into cattle pasture.

Ophtis 'Earth Eye', a deep lake in the southern mountains of the Delua Mountains, with Ernoisa on the shore. From the north there is plenty Rain moistens the wheat here. Legend has it that this is a sacred place for the Gupalas, who consider this lake a gateway to another world.

Aiolia is located in the fertile Aris Valley in the hinterland of the empire. The local dialect is mixed with Pala language vocabulary. Before the arrival of the imperial people, the inhabitants of the central continent spoke Pala language.
Crios is located on a limestone ridge east of the Deruia Mountains. Highland soils are suitable for high quality horse grass.
Pertamis is located in a valley in the Deruia Mountains. The people here have been raising cattle since pre-Kalad times, passing traders in the area. Easy access to milk and butter for travelers.

Alatis is located on the flat southern end of Lake Laconis, in a triangular lowland formed by the Nevis River. The local shallow and muddy lake is rich in flounder and crayfish, and trout in the upper Nevis.
Nortanisa is a fishing village on the south bank of Lake Laconis. Villagers place fishing nets and cages on the shallows of the lake to catch carp and snapper. , sea bass and crayfish.

Hetania is located at the foot of a mouth in the northeastern part of the Deruia Mountains. Like many villages nearby, the local forest farmers still speak the Pala language. .Pala was the language spoken by the tribes here before the imperial invasion.

Villaros sits on the gentle slopes of the eastern side of the Deruia Mountains, east of the Empire. Although the slopes are mostly covered with beech and oak forests, they produce good crops here. horse grass, and it has been a breeding ground for imperial army horses since ancient times.

Ortra is a relatively young settlement named after an imperial general who looked east here at dawn and saw the Mize After the beauty of Yard, the mountain village in the eastern part of the empire was named in the future. This is the horse breeding farm of the empire. Forage is brought from the eastern grasslands to provide horses for the imperial cavalry.
Themis is located in the mountains of the hinterland of the Empire, beneath the limestone cliffs of Mizeyard. The grasses that grow on the local hills are ideal for raising sheep.

Samata is located on a slope in the sun-drenched Mizeyard Highlands. The slopes have been transformed into terraces for the cultivation of mulberry trees. The leaves are harvested , put it in a vat to feed silkworms.

Awaxington is located on the desolate eastern end of Mizeyard in the mountains of the central empire. Villagers have cleared the area of ​​undergrowth and thorns, including pungent wormwood (the village was once named after this wormwood), it is convenient to make room for planting mulberry trees, and then collect mulberry leaves to raise silkworms.

Borre Agora is located in the frigid north of the Empire, surrounded by a network of icy lakes on the Illatan transport line. The nearby Imperial fort looms over the waterway, watching Raiders of Sturgia and Qusset. The lowlands here are good for flax.

Kaira is situated in a network of rivers, lakes, and lagoons known as the Calesa. A little further east is a rather barren alkaline Soil, but here, the alluvial plains formed by the Kaleza and Tiacus rivers can grow wheat.

Policia sits on the border of Aserai by a network of rivers and lakes called Kalesa. Villagers mine salt from a lagoon to the west, where Before it was divided by the spit, it was a bay in the Sea of ​​Perth. Other inhabitants of Calradia took a detour when they passed through this lowland, because the air here was muddy and smelly, but the locals kept their eyes on Assai. Lai people are proud of their responsibilities.

Tigerathos is located on the north side of the Kaleza River, which outlines the borders of the Aserai and then merges into a network of lakes, streams, and lagoons. Local villagers keep sheep that feed on the grass in the swamp.

Ereboros is located next to a lagoon that was part of the Sea of ​​Perth before it was closed by a recently formed spit. Villagers from the creek Clay is dug up at the bottom and sold to pottery kilns in Danutiska and nearby towns.

The village of Artfenia is close to the mouth of the Setis River, and the river then divides into three branches downstream to form the Three Rivers Valley. At the Setis River it flows into the Pola Near the estuary of Sihai, the villagers opened the salt field.
Gorcorius sits on the Goliath River, the southernmost tributary of the River Settles through the Three Rivers Valley. The abundant black soil makes this area It became the granary of the empire.
Avalypus is located near the upper Calesa River, on the warm hills of the Southern Empire by the sea. The rich black soil makes this area an Empire Granary.
Alysion is located on the northern shore of the Sea of ​​Pellas. The local fishing industry was quite poor, so the villagers built salt pans in the shallows.

Canolos is located on the flat southern end of the Lycarian plain. Before the imperial invasion, the area was a good horse breeding area for Lycari Ya's riders supplied the steeds that chased Kalad's enemies until the former was finally defeated and absorbed into the Imperial cavalry.

Tervia is located in the middle of the Lycaria Valley, where the plains slowly climb to the base of the Oni Stone Mountains. Villagers graze their sheep on the hillside, and hovering vultures overlook The misty plain below, from which the mountain gets its name.
Zestia is located at the junction of the Lycarian plain and the seaside Iltar hills. Sheep eat on gentle slopes overlooking misty flats grass.
Sagora is on a low ridge in the middle of the Lycarian plain. This area is one of the more rocky and less fertile parts of the plain , but the bushes in the valley can still be eaten by sheep.
Popsia is located in a narrow canyon between Oni Stone Mountain and Lake Ophrtis. The trees grow tall in the shade between the mountains and the villagers Will cut down pine trees and sell the wood.

Canterion is located in the east of the Lycarian plain, where the gently rising slopes receive more rainfall than the rest of the plain. Long before the imperial invasion, The rich local pastures make it an excellent horse breeding area.

Rantas is on the vast plains south of Lake Tanasis. This is home to fine sheep, but this area will be overrun by imperial fugitives, freedmen Riders and steppe nomads sweep, and local villagers have learned to keep an eye on the sheep.

Lartus is located at the southern end of Lake Tanasis. There is a salt mine near the village, and salt springs occasionally rise above the water, leading people to believe that this is the The legendary gateway to the underground sea where ghosts gather.
Parasenos sits beside a low pass that connects the Tani Plains to the Kaleza River. Villagers graze their sheep in the meadows that the scrubland turns into.

Thaldenis is located under a gypsum cliff overlooking the Setis River. The fine soil on the mountain is washed down by the current to form clay, which is what allows the southern part of the empire Something that the potter's eyes light up.
Spotia sits on the gently flowing river Settles. The rolling hills here constitute one of the granaries of the empire.
Amikon sits on a rugged ridge between the Oran Stone Mountains and the Aris Valley. The inhabitants are shepherds who make cumin Known for its salsa.
Settlements is located at the southern end of Lake Thanaissis. It is low-lying and is one of the main grain producing areas in the eastern border area.
Vargonis is a fishing village on the shores of Lake Tanasis. Giant barracudas are sometimes found in the lake, and more commonly bass and snapper.
Unalica sits on the west shore of Lake Tanasis. This depression is a great place to grow flax.
Primessos is located in the upper wooded valley of the Garvis River. The local climate is suitable for raising pigs that feed on the acorns of the southern oak.

Montos sits at the bottom of the Curción cliffs, near the border with Albatania. Local forest farmers keep an eye on their neighbors, always on the lookout for those Marauders trying to cross the Miron from east to west.
Nideon is located at the foot of the plutonic Eritreus Mountains, in the low-lying meanders of the Zeos River. It is cultivated from the marshes along the river. Flax grows in the fields.
Talcutis sits on the coast of Pellas. The sand and morning mist washed over from the offshore islands allow vineyards to be established overlooking the sand.

Neokrys is a new village on a gentle slope in the Themea Valley, recently established by a forest. The local landowners built A breeding farm was established to provide horses for the Imperial cavalry.
Alsassos is located in a wide valley north of the Pellas Sea - west of Themea. Despite the relatively dry climate, farmers rely on artesian wells to Good wheat harvest.
Zeokolus is located at the foot of the Iltar hills, along the coastline of the Southern Empire. Despite the relatively dry climate, farmers rely on artesian well water Still a good wheat crop.
Gamaldan is located at the head of a small cove that is parted by the larger Chalas Bay. The wines from this region are sweet and It has a high degree and is loved by people all over the empire.

Egosca is located in a wide valley south of Calradia - the beginning of Themea. Although the area gets its name from the goats that used to roam the area, Landlords have rehabilitated far more lucrative horses on this pasture.

Deladios sits on the banks of the Little Aminis, a tributary of the Aminis River that flows down from the highlands. Local villagers use the runoff from the mountains to Diverted to irrigate fertile wheat fields.

Alpotis sits on a high cliff overlooking the confluence of the Aminis, Garvis and Zeos rivers. Both sides of the mountain It is a terraced field with cisterns to collect fresh water carried by rain clouds from the ocean.

The narrow strait through which the Inland Sea of ​​Peras meets the Western Sea is named after Lycia. It is located on one side of the Peras Sea, near the wide The beach is used for the construction of salt pans.
Village is situated below the waterfall where the Aminis River pours into the Sea of ​​Perth. Villagers gather salt blocks from the sea under the cliffs on the shore.
Galengoria is located next to a rich silver vein overlooking the Garvis River. The Empire has used the silver mines produced here for centuries. Dinars are minted.
Elipa is located in the upper Aris Valley. This sunny, water-rich highland is one of the important granaries of the Empire.
Fassos is located in the rolling chalk hills of the highlands between Themea and the Arris valleys. The rich grass below makes it the best horse breed in the Empire. One of the places.
Calfignon is located on the wooded highlands between the basalt giants - Mount Eritreus and Mount Deruia. Villagers on the highlands Raising cattle on the pasture.
Vatea sits on the high slopes of the Dria Mountains, facing the valley opposite the huge basalt mountain, Mount Eritreus. Villagers dug deep shafts on steep banks to mine iron ore.
Therthenon is located in the upper Aminis Valley, beneath the basalt mountain that rises from the ground, Mount Eritreus. This area It is one of the granaries of the empire.
Le Brennon is located beside the river Armenis below Mount Eritreus, a basalt giant rising from the ground. This area is imperial One of the granaries.

Fisner is located on the Zhahan River, a tributary of the Karakazi River. Although the valley is covered with snow all year round, the spring grass still feeds a considerable amount The thick wool produced by the sheep helps people resist the local biting cold wind.
Ulan is located in the valley of the Karakazi River. The local villagers are nomads who were forced to settle down by the Khan. They have learned to Flax is grown on this low-lying muddy ground.

Kuruluk is located on the Zhahan River, a tributary of the Karakazi River. Although this valley is covered with snow all year round, the prairie ponies still rely on food Spring grasses and digging snow for food in winter are tenacious, and their thick fur helps them resist the howling winds.

Asalig sits at the foot of Mount Balth at the top of the Devsag Plateau. Villagers keep their horses on the relatively low slopes and are always on the lookout for it. Snow leopards - that's how the mountain got its name.
Kara Karat is located in a basin on the gentle edge of the eastern Devseg plateau. Not long ago, the land was dominated by nomadic peoples, and today it is Still known for breeding good horses.

Thesmiller is located on the Orzo River originating from the southern end of the Devsag Plateau. The local residents are shepherds, and due to the attacks on horse bandits by the khans of the past dynasties After the cleanup, they were able to live in peace under the powerful rule of Qusett.

Gledon and its affiliated villages extend all the way to the southern end of the Devsag Plateau, near the confluence of the Orzo and Tejahe rivers. Although the terrain is rugged , but it is famous for the high-quality clay produced in the mountain stream.
Kiraz is located in a basin at the southern end of the Devseg plateau. Not long ago, the land was dominated by nomads, and today the locals still rely on Raise sheep for a living.
Shapesht is located at the confluence of the Zahan and Karakazi rivers. The villagers make their living by mining the nearby salt mines.
Haneshi is located on a mouth of the northern Akkan hills. Red streaks on the soil and rocks indicate that the area is rich in iron ore, and the villagers Mining.
The fishing village Majin is located at the northern end of Lake Tanaissis, which is called Danazhai by the Kusaites. Fishing nets to catch all kinds of fish that travel to and from the lake.
Omrotok is located at the foot of Mount Sulun on the east side of the Devseg plateau. The villagers go to the nearby woods to harvest the few Devseg. wood.
Lanzamu is located on the southeastern plains of the Devsag Plateau. The villagers who lived as nomads not long ago were good at raising horses.
Mi Wanzhan is located at the foot of Mount Sulun on the east side of the Devsag Plateau. Not long ago, nomadic villagers raised sheep in the foothills.
Ulunjan is located at the foot of the Akkan Mountains, near the western end of the Devsag Plateau. Local villagers raise cattle to protect against the cold winter and heat.

Kamsha is located on the shore of Lake Tanasis, which is called the Danaz Sea by the Kusaites. The local fishery is not well developed, but the villagers collected it by the lake. Clay, sold to potters in Chaikan and other towns.
Ohutan is a village located in the middle of a wheat-growing region, between Lake Tanasis and Akko called the Danaz Sea by the Qusaits. A long and narrow plain between the hills.
Ispantar is located on a rocky mouth of the Akkan hills, overlooking Tanaisi, which the Qusaitians call the Danaz Sea Sihu. The main source of income for the local villagers is sheep raising.
Pabastan sits on a long and narrow plain between the Akkan hills and the Tanasis Lake called the Danaz Sea by the Qusaits. It's a great place to grow wheat.

Karahan is located in the foothills of Koshi Rohini, the foothills of the Dawn Mountains. Local villagers buy horses from migrating tribes and keep some themselves. Many of the horses of the Set's army came from here.
Nuchuk is located under a rocky outcrop named Keshi Rohini in Darcy, the Dawn Mountains. Most of the local villagers are Newly settled nomads who keep sheep like their ancestors.
Danara is located beside the thirst-quenching salt lake called Chaga Naur in the Qusetts. The local villagers extract the salt from the bitter lake water.

Koshi Ajik is located in a narrow arid canyon at the foot of the so-called Lover's Mountain from which the place got its name. Horses are purchased from nomads and sold to the Qusett nobles in the town.

Rodobas, or the 'House of Obas', is named after a long-dead Sturgia chief on the mountain. The village is located in On a ridge overlooking the Ikara wasteland, it is used as a base for hunters who hunt for furs in the dark forest below.
Forint is situated by a field of rye and barley near the Garza River on the edge of the Ikara wasteland. The village relies on selling its grain to hunters in the forest. The district prospered.

Cargrave was once known as Carl Graves - the ring fort of Graves, chieftain of Battania, but two generations ago the place was Conquered by the Gia. It is located on the coast of Valcheg Bay, where the waters are relatively calm, and many species of fish swim here during their breeding season, which local fishermen make good use of.
Safna sits on a high ridge overlooking the rapids that connect Lake Laconis with the narrow Mazopol Bay. Villagers lush on sea cliffs grazing cows in the grass.
Malabrot sits on a high rocky ridge between Mazopol Bay and the Biarri Sea. If this bitter cold land is not rich in mountains Iron ore, it is estimated that no one will settle here.

Dvorusta is a fishing village overlooking the rapids that connect Valcheg Bay to Lake Laconis. Villagers walk along the cliffs at dawn Go down and catch salmon leaping over rocks, and herring and cod in the sea.

Jono Bass, or 'Black Forest', is located on a field carved out by a forest overlooking the river Miron pouring into Lake Laconis. Great waterfall. Villagers grow rye and barley in the misty fields next to the waterfall.

Skolin sits on a promontory that separates Jatom Bay from Lake Laconis. Villagers fish for freshwater flounder in the narrow bay waters , and larger aquatic animals such as barracuda are also caught in the main lake area.

Bocho Wagoka is located on a small elevation on the steep north shore of Lake Laconis. The village lives by fishing, catching bass and sea bream from the lake's waters. Fish, salmon, and occasionally giant sturgeon and barracuda.

Grafström is located at the foot of Mount Iletan, a steep and perilous peak in Eastern Calradia, named after one of the steppe peoples. Gods. There are many fur animals in this wilderness, such as minks, foxes, rabbits, etc.

Omkani is situated between the shores of Lake Laconis and the snow-covered Cherteg Mountains. Villagers in this area raise pigs and use salt and garlic Pickled pork fat and sold all over the Northland.
Yangutum is located in a corner of the Cherteg Mountains on the northern shore of Lake Laconis. Local villagers have discovered iron ore on the slopes of the hill.

Vicebrot is a sheep-raising village on the gentle slopes of Mount Illetan, just under the network of glacial lakes known as the Illetan Transport Line. Although the The area is cold and remote, but its importance as a trade node between Laconis and Lake Tanasis, between the Empire and the Steppe, still allows it to have a relatively dense population.
Bukitz is located on the eastern slope of Mount Iletan on the border of Qusset. The villagers here raise a highland cattle breed that resists blowing from the mountains. A biting cold wind is coming.

Alof is on the edge of a network of glacial lakes called the Illatan Transport Line. Villagers grow rye and barley on high ground overlooking the lake, fertile The black soil compensates for the long local winter and short growing season.

The villagers of Kvor will graze some small, well-fed cattle at the foot of the Cherteg. Among these people are refugees from all over Calradia and Descendants of the disillusioned, they live in seclusion in the cold boreal forest.
Ladakhmed is located in a basin in the Cherteg Mountains. Local villagers grow flax on the muddy valley floor.

Alebate is nestled deep in the forests of northeastern Sturgia. This remote land has long been the place where the North fled oppression, debt and feud. A refuge for people, the local accent is very much influenced by the forest peoples, the Vani.
Korchas is at the narrowest point of Valcheg Bay. Villagers head west to catch cod, salmon and other cold water fish that venture into the bay.
Kaboul sits on the plateau of the Kachar Peninsula, somewhat sheltered by a high ridge to the north. Local villagers grow barley and grain.

Jemiyan is a fishing village on the north coast of the Kachar Peninsula. Villagers cross the storms that swept the Biarri Sea to harvest cod and char full of fish, Sometimes even small whales are caught.
Callioc sits on the plain between the Epir hills and the Biscayne hills in central Vallandia, where flax is grown in the marshes .

Etilfield is located near a low mouth on the border of Albatania, where the Ettilire flows from a spring on the cliffs of the Ucalion massif Spit out. Local villagers grow wheat and sell it to troops stationed nearby.
Lord Down takes its name from the iron-rich red soil of the Lyonor Hills. The mines in the region supply iron ore to many forges in the kingdom of Vallandia. stone.
Maleven sits on the steep forested slopes of the Leonor Mountains, overlooking Lake Oaks. Villagers harvest tall trees and sell them to coastal cities .

A small river originates in the mountains of the Ebo peninsula and eventually joins Lake Ox, where Oritang is located. The current velocity reaches a nearby corner The place has been slowed down so that villagers can dig up the clay the potters need from the river bank.
Fregion sits on the plains north of Palavender, from which the warm southern currents of Vallandia give way to the cold north. Local villagers grow flax in swamps and meadows.
Marin is located on the gentle slopes west of Lake Oaks. Southerly currents keep the misty mornings exceptionally cool and the warm afternoons allow local grapes to thrive.
Wallumby sits overlooking the mouth of the Trang River. Flax is cultivated on the swamps by the river.
Roland is located in the forest valley of central Trang. Villagers feed their pigs on acorns from the oak forest.
Larnaq is located on the gentle hills of the lower Trang Valley. Villagers grow rye, barley and wheat to sell to the hungry near Paravind of urban residents.

The grassy green hills to the north of the Trang River are divided by a steep gorge, at the mouth of which lies Palisson. The soil is poor, but the villagers He has done a good job in raising livestock such as pigs.
Philbeck sits on a large rock overlooking the rugged Biscayne coast in central Vallandia. The climate is warm year-round and the Biscayne slopes The grapes are growing satisfactorily.

Merrock is a small fishing village overlooking a cove on the Biscayne coast. Villagers sail to the west in search of mullet and bass close to the coast , and look for tuna and sardines near the islands to the south.
Nogren sits on a slope in the Biscayne hills in central Vallandia. Local villagers tend their sheep on pastures between coastal woods and alpine cliffs. .
Arromanque is located in the Nar Valley, which runs through the Biscayne and Epile mountains. This warm land in southern Vallandia is ideal for olive cultivation .
Motte is located in the Nar Valley, which runs through the Biscayne and Epile mountains. This warm land in southern Vallandia is ideal for growing olives.
Alostang sits on a rock overlooking the ocean at the foot of Mount Biscayne. This warm land in southern Vallandia is ideal for olive cultivation.
Shonall sits overlooking the access road through the Biscayne Mountains. The local villagers, like many in the middle of the kingdom of Vallandia, specialize in pig farming.
Savant is nestled in the warm grasslands north of Salas Bay. This land is considered a high-quality horse farm by the Valandians.
The village of Village is located by a creek running down from the Epile hills in Chalas Bay, a warm land ideal for olive trees.

It is said that the warrior Orsa landed in Orsje and stuck his spear on the beach. Today it is famous for the brave fishermen who Take a risky voyage in search of the cod swarms engulfed by the cold northern current.
Kananke is located in the damp woods north of Lanenor, where cedars grow into towering trees in the sea fog. Villagers use traps to catch beavers, Mink and rabbit for their fur.

Le Mannthal is in the mountains of the Eber Peninsula, with towering spruce and firs on the steep slopes. Villagers use traps to trap fur beasts , such as minks, rabbits, and foxes. This barren land has recently attracted many new settlers, who have come for the relative freedom of the forest, and the rule of the Valandian nobles is much looser than in the south.
Arantas is located in the middle of the mountainous Igbo Peninsula. The soil is poor and the climate is cold, but the rich iron ore resources support the local economy.
Alyswest was once a barren swamp, but the Valandian settlers drained the water and planted wheat and black wheat.

The city now known as Salas dates back to when the first Caladians settled on the shores of the continent. At the height of the empire, Its capital was moved to Balavinos in the north, and Salas became an important port for maritime affairs and trade. The nobles of the empire built their own cool villas on the warm beaches near the surrounding fjords, from time to time. Cruising the perimeter of the island in a dinghy. With the arrival of the Valandians, Salas fell into the hands of the ruthless De Cortan family, whose untold wealth fueled the latter's ambitions.

Guyaz was once a commercial republic that dominated trade between the West Sea and the Peras Sea, and the locals speak a now nearly extinct Kan language - and a dialect of Nahasa Similar. But the hegemony of the empire gradually squeezed its trade and the local rulers were replaced by the merchants of Nahasa. It was intermittently subservient to the empire in the past, but now it is Banu Hulyan-Asai Important territory of the ruling clan of Rasultan origin.

Located in the mountains of the Ebo Peninsula, Lovaratis was never quite an imperial town. Nord settlers believed rumours that they could mine silver and hunt wild beasts. , and there was a massive influx into the area, where there were far more Nords than Caladians, even on the eve of the Valandian invasion. The Valandians also realized the potential, because despite the winter climate Alas, this land is still the most densely populated part of the kingdom. The vast farmland in the valley supports settlers from the south who hope to find a pot of gold here.

The legend of Sarpeia of O'Nila is one of the epics of the Eastern Frontier. Like many others, it appears to be written for the conquest of a righteous empire. Sarpeia Daughter of a senator who was kidnapped by a Pala chief and brought back to his fortress here. Years later, when Imperial troops came to the city to rescue her, she begged them to see her as a baby The army withdrew for the sake of her son. Because her horrific husband threatened to throw the child over the city walls and would not give it to the child's mother's kin. The story says that the legion retreated, but the boy joined after he grew up as a warrior He killed the empire and killed his biological father. Today, this is the center of the horse industry in the Eastern Plains.

Pen Cannock perched on the top of the mountain, watching the Trang River rush from the Ucalion plateau to the lowlands of Vallandia. According to legend, the goddess of water lived in In the dark pools beneath the rocks, where travelers and intruders are tempted to step into death, there are only rare cases where the goddess falls in love with a hero, bestowing him victory and blessings. Of course, these fishermen The rumors here are just out of reverence for the upper Trang River, because one wrong step on the slippery stones will cause one to fall into the fast-flowing water.

Aqqarat - the 'white fortress' as the Qusetts call it - was created by the dreaded Padisha Ahoshtar in his quest against Devsag. Built during the second expedition. The sacred fire above the fort, which has not been extinguished for decades, symbolizes his suzerainty over the local tribes. But Padisah's rule was also gradually on the defensive like an empire, and finally retreated to the east. Now here Flying in the wind is Khan's ponytail.

Located in the shadow of the basalt rock of Mount Eritreus, Lothai was formerly a fortress of the Pala people, also known as Lotash. After Lagta , Lotash also quickly fell into the hands of the Empire. The local Pala chief slaughtered dozens of Imperial citizens under his protection after hearing about what happened in the neighboring country. The long-haired general Sarapius, the eccentric character, Led the retribution force to capture Lotash and raze it to the ground. 'We took Ragta with despicableness, and no blood was shed; we took Lotash with honor, and let it bleed. scull. These two things will be a stain on our reputation' he said afterward. 'The winner will take the spoils, but there will always be a stigma.'

Garlen looks out over the eroded Biscayne coast. A glimpse of intrepid Biscayne fishermen as they sail deep into the West Sea, and docile sheep grazing on mist-shrouded mountains. Galen. The current king of Vallandia is descended from the family that settled in the area when Osric the Iron Wall invaded.

Mizeya is named after Mizeyad, the land of fertile mountains in the middle east of the empire. This area was once the nostalgic place of the elder Li Tu, who led the Pala people. Joined the Empire in relative peace in exchange for protection from steppe raiders. However, when he was crushed by his opponents in the Senate, he tried to organize the tribesmen, following the example of the ancient Calad system to build a rival The 'barbarian' republic. Of course this action was quickly snuffed out, but the people here—although now thoroughly Karadized—still have a natural fondness for the old republic and the republicans.

Sagot is a very common name for the hills, capes, islands, and other fortified places of Western Calradia. Sargot is a name in Massa. Middle Finger fortified camp, this tribe allied with the Valandians when they invaded. Although the Massa have left, they often wail wherever they go, even long after they've gone. People recall. This Sargot was built on a ruined imperial town, and was later resettled by the Valandians, so the settlement history of the pre-Zargot era was finally completely overwritten.

Varnovapol is located at the foot of the Cherteg Mountains, on the shore of the sparkling Lake Laconis. It is the most conquered city on Calradia, and is famous for it. It was originally a colony of the Empire, where naysayers were often exiled. The Nords seized it to expand their influence in the fur trade in Sturgia. After that, Archer from the Eastern Steppe The Special Forces captured the place and briefly made it the capital of a small khanate. Eventually the city fell into the hands of the fierce Omidov family.

Housen Fullegger is located on the southeastern edge of Calradia, where rivers and brackish lagoons link the Empire to the lands of Aserai. Fullegger, aka Farkos , is a black-faced mercenary chief from the extreme south. He built a fort here, and used the fort's strategic location to make a fortune, taking bribes from both the Empire and Aserai, and was ready to exchange Sideline. After nearly 20 years playing the game of lineup, he sailed home in a ship laden with gold, but many of the clans of Aserai still proudly claim to be descended from him.' Fullerger's Ghost Ideas 'It has also become an enduring storyline for many market storytellers.'

Makaibu is located at the northern end of Lake Tanasis, which the steppe people call Danaz. The city guards the great waterfall formed when the Karakazi River joins the lake. The The city was ruled by little Khans and Shahs for a long time. They sent trackers to drag merchant ships across the turbulent waters and charged tolls. However, because they refused to pay tribute, the last ruler of the city was headed by Ulhun Khan himself. Since then, the city has been under the control of the ruling family of Qusett.

Otungaard is located in the middle of the dry Devseg plateau, which is dry all year round but very suitable for grazing in the spring. The city was founded by Darcy-speaking merchants from The surrounding nomadic villages purchased horses, sheep, and cattle, and, accompanied by guards against steppe raiders, drove them in droves to sell them in the imperial market to the west, in order to obtain a lot of wealth. However, whether it is the city wall or the None of the mercenaries could withstand the army of Ulhun Khan, who awarded the city to the Khujit tribe in recognition of their bravery.

Osti Port, originally a small imperial port, has now become a haven for the people of the North Sea. Many of them were skilled pirates who have since then been intermittently They were employed by various factions of the Imperium to fight their opponents during the civil war of His own kinsmen tell the story of the wealth they will gain once they invade this place.

Saneopa sits on a low pass in the valley of Nevis leading to Lake Ophotis in the north. The Pala people in this area, like the Altanians, The lake is regarded as a sacred place, and Lake Ophotis is regarded as the gateway to the other world. The noisy and prosperous Saneopa is an important trade center in the interior of Calradia, and it is also dark and silent. The lake water is in stark contrast.

Tyar is located in the western foothills of Iltan, on the eastern border of Sturgia. The area has long been remote from the power struggles of other Sturgians. The locals are mostly homeless. , traders, horse breeders, and fur hunters. The local nobles occasionally marry princesses with the nomadic tribes to the east to cement trade agreements, and their ancestry lists the names of several great khans.

Askair occupies the middle of the Damar River, where the water weaves its way through the Djaljarai cliffs. The area has been densely populated for thousands of years, but the surging The river never stops, and it bursts its banks every few hundred years, erasing the previous imprint. The latest regional metropolis here was built hundreds of years ago during the Empire's furthest penetration into Nahasa. A camp that the Aserai tribe occupied after the Legion retreated.

The inland city of Hubia is said to have been built on the ruins of a lavish hunting lodge of the fallen and brutal King Turan, who enslaved the family of Patriarch Aserai and was killed by him in vengeance Death. This memory may explain the worldview of the ruthless Banu Gilard, who now controls the city and hates all frivolity. But the night wind here still smells the seductive scent of jasmine. It was here that the hero Nimr perished. He was caught in the boudoir of a girl from Gilard and put to death in a cage hanging from the market.

It is said that the legendary queen Ashura severely punished the gods who harassed her people and imprisoned them in the cave above Gahira, and she carved into the rock the legendary The eight-pointed star, seals these gods here. She condemns these gods to go deep underground to carry water to nourish the spring, so that it constantly spews living water from the crevices of the rock. For centuries, the spring water has been irrigating Gasila Date palm gardens with surrounding villages.

Ortysia, named after the quails that lived in the swamps of the surrounding coast, and was the first Karadish colony in the Sea of ​​Perth. In the first few For centuries, the natives were ruled by the Cannae city-state of Guyaz, but it wasn't long before the expansion of the empire made the colony part of the Republic. Many sailors came from the pirate-infested Shalas Bay Islands, and for centuries , these sailors were grateful for the towering lighthouse, whose beams penetrated the mists that shrouded the Sea of ​​West Perth and heralded the arrival of ships in safe waters patrolled by the Imperial Sea Patrol.

Marunas, 'the galloping horse of the shoals', yet not at all near the river. But the bards of Battania love places that don't match their names, Because such a place is a good place to compile a lore. This time, the hero on the stage is Ochlegan, who is prophesied to defeat the seven sons of Granis in seven duels in seven fords, where he will meet The last enemy. He slit the throat of his beloved horse, waded through the bloody stream, defeated his ultimate enemy, and fulfilled the prophecy.

It is said that, centuries before the arrival of the Imperials, Razih was the base for the Kan explorers to colonize the coast of Pelaas. Their bow decorations The statues are woven from vines, symbolizing wealth, wine, love and war. Today, the Kan accent has been completely replaced by the Nahasa dialect, and their religion has been completely forgotten, but their logo has been preserved, still Stories of brave adventurers who risked everything for glory.

Zeonika is located on the coast of the Illatar hills, a land rich in wine, grain and horses. It takes its name from Lady Zeonne, one of the few One of the women who ruled the Empire - still nominally as her son's regent, not the Empire's Empress. The place is also known for the Zeonna Wind, a northerly summer monsoon that blows Nahasa The heat of the desert is carried across the Sea of ​​Perth to the south of the empire. The weather is mild throughout the rest of the season, and this climate has given birth to countless poems that allude to the fleetingness of passion.

The city of Argolon is located at the mouth of the cold, slow river Nevis into Lake Laconis. This land once belonged to the Laconians, who regarded the empire as their protector , guarded against the more belligerent Pala people. They welcomed the arrival of the Imperials, intermarryed with the settlers of the Empire, their chieftains became the elders of the empire, and their ancient languages ​​and customs disappeared.

Epicrotea, meaning 'invincible', named after the surly long-haired general Sarapius, who defeated a Battanian army, Guarded the Empire's territory west of Lake Laconis. The tower here looks out over the Miron and is often the first stop for northerners to discover the fearsome armies of the south.

Iyakis sits in a rift in the Jairjara cliffs, where the occasional torrential rain of the desert has allowed people to save it for irrigation. Generations of generations In the past, this place was just an autonomous outpost of the empire called Yachios, ruled by the Karasius family. However, fifty years ago, they saw the signs of the empire's southward establishment of hegemony, so they began to cooperate with Nahasa's The tribesmen intermarryed. Today, they are called the Karaz, and they, like other noble families of the Aserai, have a seat at the sultan's council.

Ox Hall is one of the few towns established after the kingdom of Vallandia seized the land from the Empire. The valley was once a battanian flight. The land, centered on Lake Modris - a lake in the crater of a volcanic caldera and said to be the footprint of a giant. It was conquered by Orc, a warlord of Vallandia, and the nearby Lake Ox is named after him Named. The Battanian tribes of the area were driven back inland with their legends.

Palavinos was a second important colony founded by Galadius the Great and quickly replaced Salas as the capital of the Caladians. Ultimately, the Empire The center of gravity of his rule moved eastward, but Balavinos remained the economic powerhouse of the west. When the Valandian 'Iron Wall' Osric invaded, he realized that Balavinos was the seat of power, more than It was more valuable as a source of plunder, so negotiated with the local elders to have the city surrender. The place passed down to Osric's offshoot, the House of Day Thiel, and is now known as Palavender.

Omore is located on the eastern shore of Lake Laconis. Long before Sturgia became a duchy, it was a sacred place for the forest tribesmen, whose oak trees in the woods Worshiping gods and ancestors. Today, this is a market place for fur hunters and woodcutters, who roam the Ikara wasteland to the east. The pristine silence of the forest is also replaced by the noise of hawking, sawing, and boats on the lake. Broken by the sound of unloading.

Noord merchants established Sybil in a valley in the Cherteg Mountains, where they hoped to trade furs with the local Vulcan-speaking forest people. .When the Stygian tribes were converted into duchies and the tribal chief was chosen as Boye, they began to see taxation and corvée as their due, so for those Stygians who didn't love the regulated , the land has become extremely attractive. Today, the ambitious Isharovs rule the area, but they must carefully weigh their desire for wealth or their soldiers will face unwillingness to pay And the subjects who rise up.

Ka Banthes is on top of the cliffs of Aita Druin. If one looks north on a clear sunny day, over the area that once belonged to Batania, is now But the land occupied by the Valandians and the Sturgians can see the sparkling waters of the Valcheg Bay. It is said that those who have faith will one day see the ship of the deceased High King Meng from here. Team, he will return to the world and save his people from fire and water. But now, it is more likely to see Nord adventurers and mercenaries here, their purpose is to help foreigners continue to eat Pakistan The land of Denia.

Jeccolan is located on the warm south side of the Biscayne coast, and the rolling hills are famous for olive groves. It was once a favorite holiday destination for the imperial aristocracy, who lived among the oak forests. Hunting wild bears for fun. However, the region's self-governing farmers are known for their heresies. The Greenwood Brotherhood is just the latest in a series of rebellions that have erupted here, with nobles sometimes even paying to aid them against rivals The Valandian family.

The city of Poros is located on the northern coast of the Perasian Sea. The warm, rolling hills here are ideal for domesticating sheep and horses. Herders have a reputation for being proud and violent, and the local Leo The nobles of the House of Nipades also carefully respected their autonomy. The neighing cattle and bloody brawls made a beautiful scene here. It is said that Leonipades never interfered in such disputes, Unless both sides of the fight invite them to adjudicate. But once they do, all will obey.

Fikaon is located at the beginning of the Cetis Valley, an important center of grain production in the middle of the Empire. Fikaon was the largest city of Pala, and its ruler united the various The tribes resisted the Empire's invasion of the region. However, when the victory of the Empire was inevitable, they chose to make peace. Now the local people are completely Karadized, and people say that the people here are serious, respectable, and businessmen Brainy, dependable, just no sense of humor.

The Pala chief of Amitatis has a very bad reputation. He is a tyrant. In pursuit of immortality, he will not hesitate to slaughter innocent people just to please the gods of the underworld. He must not Avoided a conflict with the imperial army, and during the siege, an earthquake shattered the city walls, allowing imperial soldiers to enter the city. In the ensuing burning and looting, more people died than the tyrant killed himself. , but this is war. Some blame the wrath of heaven for this result, and this is the mainstream propaganda for the Empire's firm foothold in the region.

Chaikan is located beside the reed meadows on the shore of Lake Tanasis. In the days when the East was still an imperial protectorate, boats loaded with hides, wool and salt sailed past the peaceful The lake came back with the silk and silver of the empire. The Khusets came, so did the war, and the waterway trade stopped, but Chaikan remained as an important trade transfer station and military base, and became the Uerhun The fief of the Naet tribe. The khan of Qusait stood in the attic of the palace, and his eyes crossed the lake to the rolling hills in the distance, where perhaps one day he will be able to graze his horses.

Revell is an important town on the rocky Kachar Peninsula and Balgard's traditional rival. According to legend, the husband of Balgard's princess Akina was killed by lightning Killed by the Vil, but she accepted the offer of the enemy king to marry him to settle the dispute. On the wedding night, however, she blocked the door of the hall, and put the king and a hundred of his people with the warriors Burned alive in it. The dispute was later settled through a series of treaties and marriages, and it ended happily, but the Revells still held a grudge against Balgard's soaring Gundarov dynasty.

Every kingdom has a city where its inhabitants will be ridiculed for being pedantic and unsophisticated. For the Empire, such a city is Jarmalius. The city is One of the first imperial colonies established in the interior of the Sea of ​​Perth as a base for the control of the tribes of Sipara. Balavinos happily accepts loot and slaves from here, and snickers behind his back. The situation changed after the military coup d'état by General Karthos of Garmalius, when a senator nervously begged him to repeat a decree, unable to understand his heavy accent, drew his sword and said: 'Do you understand this?'

Silonia is situated on the eastern shore of Lake Tanasis. The city was once peaceful and prosperous, and was even synonymous with luxury and depravity. The site was originally an imperial silk production The center, at the same time, was also the distribution center for the goods brought in by the 'Vitanesia' - the empire's industry and protectorate on the other side of the Great Lakes. However, the Qusetts arrived and took the Transanesia from the Empire's hands. The elders of Sylonia were also forced to relearn the art of war, dusting off the thick dust from their gilded armor, sharpening their jeweled swords, and leading their followers against the warriors of Ulhun.

The port of Sanara is the gateway to the grains of the lower Damar to the whole world to feed. Periodically, the Empire has always marched southward along the coast of Plath with the intention of capturing this strategic objective. . Although the Legion was forced to retreat many years ago, Sanara is still one of the largest metropolitan cities in the entire Calradia continent. Merchants from all over the world gather here to compete with each other on the price.

Lycaron, a natural fortress located on a gentle slope jutting out from the mighty Orni Stone Mountain. During the last years of the Empire's conquest, the Pala tribe negotiated with the Empire and carried out Peaceful union, their homeland was again taken by the rebel leader Getu. The ensuing siege was only the first of Lycaron's repeated sieges in the following centuries, as the city was surrounded by Rich in silver veins, any pretender to the throne who wants to seize power in a civil war will be eyeing here.
