There are even rumors that the vultures living on the top of the stone mountain have eaten every people on Calradia.

Diatma, the city of the Inquisition, founded by an imperial general on the ruins of the Temple of Deruia overlooking Lake Laconis. The Deruians - The Pala people in the farthest north - fought their last battle here, raised a rebellion against the Empire, and were then annihilated. According to legend, they were surrounded by the shallows of the lake and fought valiantly to the last man, The scarlet lake engulfed them one after another.

Xiao Nong, sad Xiao Nong, her history is like the dark water of Lake Taiwar, which makes people cry. Looking at the tower, Algana with beautiful hair is There weeping for her beloved Gora Wan. Even the soul of the afterlife was moved by this boundless grief, allowing his reflection to appear on the lake day and night to comfort her broken heart. Days after that Here, this land is often attacked by Sturgia raiders, and not far from the place where King Ariel disappeared, Karadog took this opportunity to rise.

The frontier city of Danustika dominates the Kaleza - a transport network of lakes and lagoons. It has long guarded the frontier against the Aserai and the Far East Dasi The various Shahs and Padisshah attacks of human beings. Many Imperial Legionnaires stationed here could not wait to write on the walls cursing the city's scorching summer, salty water and flying from Kaleza. Mosquitoes. But the local residents are proud of their responsibility to protect the border and the country, and laugh at the sick soldiers around them.

Valgard was founded by Nord settlers on the edge of the icy Mazopol Bay. According to legend, the first Nords to come here arrogantly demanded the nearby Vulcan. Pay tribute to the Sturgian tribe, who allied with the newcomers to drive the newcomers back to their longships. However, the victors quarreled over the uneven distribution of the spoils until a shrewd Nord tribute Dahl landed here and distributed the weapons and armor of his dead people fairly to the locals. The locals recognized Gondar's rule over the area, and his descendants continued to intermarry with the Sturgians, becoming what is now Sturgeon. The princes of Gia.

Dunglaris, meaning 'The Rock of Granis', stands on the top of a mountain and overlooks the dark lake in the hinterland of Albatania, Lake Taiwal. Its name comes from a An ancient queen, according to legend, she has been married to five high kings of Batania, even above them. This place is a secret holy place in Batania, symbolizing the kingship of Batania , so while not every Battanian High King reigns here, they all aspire to control it.

The town of Odokh is located at the foothills of the Koshi Rohini - the Dawn Mountains. As one of the most remote towns on the Devseg plateau, it is named after King Ahhak - The palace of a mythical tyrant is famous all over the world, and the king's shoulders are wrapped with vipers. Even today, rumors continue that the Dawn Mountains are a place of black magic and occult arts, and outsiders are not allowed to enter. The city is in Kuwait After the suits were dressed, they were assigned to the Heerbite, who intermarryed the mountain people, respected local customs, participated in their religious ceremonies—and, of course, guarded their secrets.

Baltahan, which means axe fortress, was built by the Eltans, the cousins ​​of the Qusaites who lived in the mountains. Hundreds of years ago, their leaders were exiled to this plain and established The fort was built to guard the Illetan transport line - a transport network of lakes and rivers that separated the realm of Sturgia from the kingdom of the Qusait. The harsh winter kept the Empire out of reach, but no Li Feng was able to stop Wuerhan Khan's iron cavalry. The town surrendered to the Khanate 40 years ago.

Vorstrom was founded by Karad mercenary Arcacus, one of several defecting commanders who defected from the Empire during its expansion. And others hope to recreate the Empire He chose to rule as a god-king, contrary to his republican tradition. His lineage continued for generations, until the soldiers of the Empire overthrew the regime and tore down and smashed every deified statue of Arcacus and his successors . Until now, imperial elders from the west and north have accused the region's families of potential monarchists.

Amprella is located in the far north of the Empire. Guards stand on high towers, always watching for signals from the northern, eastern or western frontier fortresses to warn raiders The barracks were stationed with horse archers composed of loose 'freemen', waiting for orders to attack the steppe cavalry. The armored cavalry assembled at the gates of the city and competed with the princes of Sturgia for Iraq. Trade control of the Letan Line - a network of surrounding lakes.

The Empire is a Ragta obtained by intrigue and is therefore not honorable. An exiled Imperial merchant murders the Pala chief who hired him, occupies the fortress and invites Imperial colonists , and finally dedicated the city to the Empire. Although the Senate condemned his actions, he still accepted the gift. Now that the area has been completely Karadized, the Battanians of the North still remember it as Heart. Whenever the imperial envoys began to brag about the sacrosanctity of treaties and agreements, the Battanians would nod to each other and say invariably: 'Lageta'.

Pons is one of the northernmost settlements in the Empire. The site is named for its location at the crossroads of the Illetan transport line, a series of glacial lakes The network allows ships to pass between the Laconis and Tanais lakes. The area is relatively sparsely populated, but the lush meadows are home to large herds of cattle.
Thememos is located in the wooded hills at the northern end of Lake Tanasis. Many of the local villagers are forest farmers who harvest and sell oak, beech and pine trees. To the town by the lake.

Agarmon is next to the confluence of two small, fast northern rivers, the Galchas and Miron. The residents have intermarryed with the neighboring Sturgians for generations, and the exchanges were quite friendly, but the outbreak of the war has made the relationship between the two sides tend to be tense.
